I think that all of the marksmen in the group listed directly below should get small to medium nerfs, such as slightly reduced base AD or attack speed per level growth.
{{champion:29}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:18}} {{champion:222}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:21}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:498}} 

If minor nerfs to the group listed above causes the group listed below to immediately jump up to replace them, then we'll know that the marksmen class was/is considerably overtuned, and it should be followed up with small itemization nerfs or nerfs to the champions listed below.
{{champion:110}} {{champion:15}} {{champion:429}} {{champion:202}} {{champion:22}} {{champion:15}} {{champion:81}} {{champion:236}} 

Following this cycle of gradually nerfing the strongest meta marksmen, we might eventually get to have a meta where a ranged ADC isn't essentially guaranteed to be on each team.  In that case the "Bot" role might finally be more than a synonym for "ADC".

I definitely think the nerfs should be very gradual though, so that other repercussions can be dealt with as they pop up.  For example, if weaker marksmen causes tanks to become excessively hard to kill, then DPS mages could be granted better itemization.  Allowing a slow meta shift will also let melee DPS champions options, such as {{champion:11}} {{item:1419}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3124}}, to naturally enter the meta to help fill the tank-shredding role.

I think Riot should set this as a goal to stretch out over next season via small steps so that players can adjust without panic.
